      • readFullyOrNothing

        public static boolean readFullyOrNothing(InputStream in,
                                         byte[] buffer)
                                  throws IOException
        Fills a buffer from an InputStream. If it doesn't contain any more data, returns false. If it contains some data, but not enough to fill the buffer, EOFException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read from
        buffer - the buffer to fill
        Returns:
        true if the buffer was filled completely, false if there was no data in the InputStream
        Throws:
        EOFException - if there was some, but not enough, data in the InputStream to fill the buffer
        IOException

      • readFully

        public static void readFully(InputStream in,
                             byte[] buffer)
                      throws IOException
        Fills a buffer from an InputStream.
        Parameters:
        in - the InputStream to read from
        buffer - the buffer to fill
        Throws:
        EOFException - if there was not enough data in the InputStream to fill the buffer
        IOException

      • closeResource

        public static void closeResource(Closeable closeable)
        Quietly attempts to close a Closeable resource, swallowing any exception.
        Parameters:
        closeable - the resource to close. If null, no action is taken.

      • close

        public static void close(ServerSocket serverSocket)
        Quietly attempts to close a ServerSocket, swallowing any exception.
        Parameters:
        serverSocket - server socket to close. If null, no action is taken.

      • deleteQuietly

        public static void deleteQuietly(File f)
        Ensures that the file described by the supplied parameter does not exist after the method returns. If the file didn't exist, returns silently. If the file could not be deleted, returns silently. If the file is a directory, its children are recursively deleted.

      • delete

        public static void delete(File f)
        Ensures that the file described by the supplied parameter does not exist after the method returns. If the file didn't exist, returns silently. If the file could not be deleted, fails with an exception. If the file is a directory, its children are recursively deleted.

      • rename

        public static void rename(File fileNow,
                          File fileToBe)
        Ensures that the file described by fileNow is renamed to file described by fileToBe. First attempts to perform a direct, atomic rename; if that fails, checks whether the target exists, deletes it, and retries. Throws an exception in each case where the rename failed.
        Parameters:
        fileNow - describes an existing file
        fileToBe - describes the desired pathname for the file

      • toFileName

        public static String toFileName(String name)

      • getPath

        public static String getPath(String... parts)
        Concatenates path parts to a single path using the File.separator where it applies. There is no validation done on the newly formed path.
        Parameters:
        parts - The path parts that together should form a path
        Returns:
        The path formed using the parts
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parts param is null or empty

      • getFileFromResources

        public static File getFileFromResources(String resourceFileName)

      • getFileFromResourcesAsStream

        public static InputStream getFileFromResourcesAsStream(String resourceFileName)

      • touch

        public static void touch(File file)
        Simulates a Linux touch command, by setting the last modified time of given file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to touch

      • copy

        public static void copy(File source,
                        File target)
        Deep copies source to target and creates the target if necessary.

        The source can be a directory or a file and the target can be a directory or file.

        If the source is a directory, it expects that the target is a directory (or that it doesn't exist) and nests the copied source under the target directory.

        Parameters:
        source - the source
        target - the destination
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source was not found or the source is a directory and the target is a file
        HazelcastException - if there was any exception while creating directories or copying

      • copy

        public static void copy(InputStream source,
                        File target)
        Deep copies source to target. If target doesn't exist, this will fail with HazelcastException.

        The source is only accessed here, but not managed. It's the responsibility of the caller to release any resources hold by the source.

        Parameters:
        source - the source
        target - the destination
        Throws:
        HazelcastException - if the target doesn't exist

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(File source,
                            File target,
                            long sourceCount)
        Copies source file to target and creates the target if necessary. The target can be a directory or file. If the target is a file, nests the new file under the target directory, otherwise copies to the given target.
        Parameters:
        source - the source file
        target - the destination file or directory
        sourceCount - the maximum number of bytes to be transferred (if negative transfers the entire source file)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the source was not found or the source not a file
        HazelcastException - if there was any exception while creating directories or copying

        IOException

                           OutputStream output)
                    throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • toDebugString

        public static String toDebugString(String name,
                                   ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Creates a debug String for te given ByteBuffer. Useful when debugging IO.

        Do not remove even if this method isn't used.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the ByteBuffer.
        byteBuffer - the ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        the debug String
